intro: Tryphostemma volkensii, commonly known as the African blue milkweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, blue or purple flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
